intro: Hieracium arizelum, commonly known as the Arizona hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It produces yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the summer months. Hieracium arizelum is a perennial herb that can spread through rhizomes, forming dense colonies in its native range.
